reviews.sentence: Hilton Memphis. Great recent visit to the Hilton on Ridge Lake in Memphis TN. Very professional staff and always pleasant helpful with any question and information about the local area. Grounds are well maintained interior is quite elegant and pleasing. Spacious convention facilities equipped for any meeting size. During the visit they hosted a local community event benefitting orphans and vulnerable children awesome to see a great organization giving back to the community and being excellent corporate citizens kept all hotel visitors in a buzz during the day Saturday. Important to see the hotel manager giving back in such a positive manner KUDOS to him her for that wise decision. Iconic building great staff classy facility. Bill.

Just expected way more. My first time staying at a Hilton and I really expected to be blown away. I was not. The hotel staff was very good. On point. However the restaurant in my opinion was over priced for what it is and the staff not very knowledgeable. Very nice but I am in hospitality also so I just wanted to be impressed. The Hilton is a pretty big name not to mention kind of pricey so the restaurant in the hotel should be first class. I was on vacation so price was really not a factor. Beautiful place. Just slightly lacking in quality.

Great Quick Stay. I was travelling across country with a couple friends and by the time we reached Memphis we needed a comfortable place to stay. As a Hilton Honors member I found this Hilton to be the ideal location for my nightit is not in the center of city but it is close enough to get in and out with very little trouble. The property is also gorgeous and the rooms appear to have been recently renovated. The glass tower that the guest rooms are located in ensures you have a good view. Twyla at the front desk was SO welcoming and friendly I wish I could meet someone like her at every property I visit. She helped us find the concierge lounge for breakfast which was pretty much amazing and equally welcoming and with Lawinter the supervisor we were hooked up with a great BQ joint and a local brewery. The room was great clean and quiet. No complaints at all. Comfy beds and luxurious bedding made me wish I had another night to spend there. Thanks to everyone.

Magnificence in Memphis. I randomly chose to take my lady on a weekend getaway to memphis for Valentines Day. Since I had not been there in over 20 years I had no concept of the city layout or nice restaurants in the area. The staff went ABOVE AND BEYOND to ensure that my trip was seamless from ordering flowers and gifts and having them in my room when we arrived to dinner reservations at the nicest eateries in the area. Upon arrival the ENTIRE staff was friendly and welcoming. The suit was breathtaking. And the hotel has a prime location.
Exceptional. Perfect weekend getaway.

Weekend trip to Memphis. My family friend and I stayed at Hilton Memphis this past weekend. The hotel grounds and amenities were excellent. Employees of the hotel were so friendly and informative but our rooms were terrible. We were on level P which is below the main level and the rooms were tiny and the hallways were dark. One of our rooms was the wheelchair accessible room. The bathroom was nearly bigger than the bedroom. And the beds. wow. The room had two double beds but I have never stayed in a hotel with double beds where the double beds were slightly bigger than twin size beds. Two adults sleeping in a double bed not a pleasant experience.

I celebrated my 50 wedding anniversary. Here in Hilton. The staff are all nice and accommodating. Our event last September 32016 was so memorable I keep on looking at those wonderful photos. The place is also nice and we love our stay in the hotel. Thank you very much Hilton Memphis.

Tv did not work properly. We were on the first floor and geese landed on the water early in the morning. Had we not already been up this would have been very aggravating. Although the water feature was nice.

What you expect from a Hilton. Stayed one night enroute to Mississippi. Customer service was outstanding. Every staff member we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The facilities were clean and up to Hilton standards. Our room on the 19th floor had a very nice view was clean and the bed was great. Cons 1the room description including a small fridge which we were planning for but our room did not have a fridge 2. unles you pay for valet parking you have a bit of a haul out to the lot. If you are sensitive to noise the side facing the interstate does pick up a bit of traffic noise. All in all we were satisfied with this Hilton experience.

excellent staff service. Shout out to all the staff at the Lake Ridge Hilton for service above and beyond. Bigger shout out to Mary in the executive lounge. What a jewel she is. I always look forward to my travel in the Memphis Area and my stay at the Lake Ridge Hilton.

Girls Weekend Away. Me and 3 friends stayed here while in Memphis the downtown area was completely booked where I usually stay. I ’m glad because I got to visit another Hilton brand hotel and I loved it. The views were spectacular and the room was nice and comfy. Parking was free and the lobby was beautiful I will return again I loved the high stories the hotel has. The ducks in the water was a pretty site to see.

I have been a Hilton Honors member since 203 and today I have received the worst customer service ever. An incident happened at the Memphis Hilton East on Dec30 2017 and I was told once management was in place I would receive a follow up phone call to address my concerns. I called on July 5 2018 to only discover that a report had never been made so a file was created and I was directed to contact the property. I called the property on July 5th and left a detailed voicemail I called again on the 7th and 8th and still no GM on site yet I have not received a phone call. I attempted to call today 712 and once again no GM on site. I started a chat with an agent whom ended our chat prematurely I called the customer care number and once I requested to speak with a manage I was placed back in que. I even threatened to cancel the 50 plus days of future reservations and the response I received was do as you desire. Is this how you treat your guests. If so I will no longer stay at Hilton properties.

They received a packaged for us and its lost. My husband stayed there during a business trip everything was great until the end. A package was received for him after his check out even when the instruction was no to do so since his stay in Memphis had come to an end and also that is against their policies. Anyway the personel took the shipment and “ sent it back ” to the address provided by my husband after learning they did n’t reject the delivery. We have been calling and requesting the tracking number but they do n’t have it and it seems the package is “ lost”. Its a shame the hotel ’s personel is not able to follow up on this or even worst they kept our package.

Decent hotel unusable internet. As far as HIlton properties go this one is fairly mediocre. The history of the many previous owners Omni and Adams Mark is clear in the dated decor slow elevators broken escalators etc. The rooms fortunately are clean and functional if dated although the water pressure leaves something to be desired. Above all else though I most strongly recommend against anyone staying at this hotel as the internet is unusable. I mean abysmal. You might be able to get something done in the early morning before anyone wakes up but in the evenings all bets are off. I spoke to the staff and while they tried their best to help they lacked the technical expertise to understand what needed to be done and the helpdesk of their provider was terrible to work with. Completely unhelpful. The hotel has had this complaint before look at old reviews and the answer is always that a big renovation is coming. While I am sure this will help if you need to get any sort of work done on a business trip go somewhere else.

Nice staff. Outdated furniture and stained covers. No microwave or fridge. The location was convenient and the staff were friendly. The room did not have a microwave or mini fridge. Like what hotel in todays age and time does not have those basic needs for travelers. The room was outdated. Still the same from when I visited years ago. The rooms are a bit small and the furniture needs upgrading. The covers had stains and that was disappointing to see at this chain of hotels will not be back anytime soon.

My rating was a 4 until my second night of stay. The pricing is GREAT. The hotel is in a GREAT area with lots of food places around. When going on the elevator I was afraid to step in the middle because it creaked super bad. Sounded like it was going to fall in. When checking in the room the bathroom smelled like old urine and there was hair in the tub and on the walls of the tub. I left a note for house keeping. Housekeeping did come clean the toilet and it smelled great but the same piece of hair was in the same exact spot. Where it is now on the wall in ROOM 1509. During the first night of stay I noticed the TV had a line in it and it was fuzzy while it was on. When I woke up I had two bites on my ankle but I bypassed it because I did n’t know if I got it from the bed or when I was out. They do have the best bed I ’ve ever slept in tho. Second night of stay my significant other rubbed my feet before bed. We were watching a movie and the TV kept losing service going black with a box saying no service for periods of time which made me lose my mind so I just fell asleep. In the middle of the night I woke up because my foot was hurting. Come to find out something bit my foot again. The hotel needs to be rebuilt. Not the Hilton I expected. This is an off BRAND Hilton.

Not so good for a Hilton. My wife and I were at this hotel for a HS Reunion and thought it was a good location for all our activities. The customer service was lacking hugely. We left for breakfast one morning at 1030 and called the front desk to ask for our room to be clean. We got back around 1230 and the room was not cleaned so I called back down and they said house keeping would be right up. At 230 pm we put a do not disturb sign on the door after two more calls. Terrible. Love Hilton ’s but this one is lackingEven the elevator sounds Lim it was going to break down.

Too Much for too little. Hotel was poor quality. It was in the middle of lobby renovations. The weekend room rate pre scheduled one night was nearly 100 more than the rate which was posted on their website. Spoke with front desk and no additional effort was given to satisfy the client. This was an unforgettable but regrettable stay.

AWFUL stay away. My family and I checked into this hotel and we had two rooms. Both rooms were musty and had mold along the floor of the tub and toilet. We attempted to get the rooms changed but were told that they had no extra rooms. When the kids got ready for bed they discovered blood on the sheets. We checked out the next morning and into another hotel. Front desk staff that we dealt with was rude and disrespectful. ZERO CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Great service in the lobby bar. Had a pleasant stay at this property over a long weekend. The hotel is currently undergoing a guest room renovation. our room had been renovated and was clean modern and comfortable. The bathroom is rather small though and did not have a tub. I think that can be attributed to the wedge shaped room since it ’s a round hotel. The pool area is basic but mostly clean however the Jacuzi was not functioning properly. For a good portion of the day the building blocks the sun. I would like to single out the great service we had at the lobby bar. Shawna and Angela were gracious friendly and very efficient. We thoroughly enjoyed interacting with them and they really were the highlight of our stay.

You ’l hear the traffic from freeway driving through your room. This hotel needs major window upgrade. I was on the 23rd floor and all night heard freeway traffic. Even with earplugs and a white noise ap on my iPad the traffic was unbelievably loud. If you want to get a good night ’s sleep look elsewhere.

Obsurd breakfast regulations. There is no signage that indicates a charged breakfast. We had a room for 1 night payed 200 dollars for that one night. Went to the breakfast area was waited to be seated. Was told to get our own food. We did so. Then at the end paid 35 dollars for eggs and bacon. Ridiculous. There is no kind of signage that indicates there will be a charge or any kind of extended wait staff assist or recommendations for food or pricing similar to a breakfast location which you expect to pay. I have stayed at multiple Hilton locations and have never had to pay for complementary breakfast. I could be like anyone else and make a scene and not pay but I chose not too and just pay and go about my way silently to save the hassle for the other guests. I understand there may have been some fine print I did not read but the fact that nothing was said or mentioned that there is a charge could lead to a unsavory experience for other guests in the future.

A tale of two hotels. The folks at the front desk were great. As diamond members we were upgraded to the top floor which was great. Unfortunately the couple next door was extremely noisy and we had to move to another floor. The hot and cold water faucets were reversed in the room during the recent upgrade. The executive lounge was closed on the weekend. The room we moved to was very comfortable and quiet.

A mixed review. Front desk service was outstanding it was great to be treated so well as a Hilton Honors member. This stay was for a meeting so we enjoyed really outstanding food and excellent professional service for meeting receptions and meals. However anyone not staying for a meeting would have pretty limited choices a Starbucks with a few food choices and what seemed to be a restaurant in a dark corner off the lobby. I liked the covered deck on the lobby level by the Starbucks. The lobby itself was bright and spacious with a nice bar. Our room was spacious and seemed clean although someone should attend to the mold in the corners of the shower before it gets worse. there is a small fitness room but it is in a dark corner of a dark hallway which is a bit off putting. The corridor to our room was also dark and the black carpeting did not help much. I was surprised that there was no place to buy a newspaper. there is plenty of parking and it is free.

Extra bogus fees. They charged my credit card 50 more for pre authorization. It ’s just unnecessary and they ’re getting 1 star. They just completed a multi million dollar renovation and there was fiberglass insulation hanging out of the ceiling in room 2401. And a big hair ball on the floor. But the main reason for the negative review is the price gouging.

Not Up to Hilton Standards. If you have a choice maybe pass on this one. The staff has some serious training issues. If you get the same answer twice you should buy a lottery ticket. Communication among the staff is terrible. If you have a conversation with someone get it in writing. Otherwise it basically did not happen. The breakfast buffet is meh. Sixteen dollars is okay for the convenience if there is a good selection and the quality is decent but neither of those apply. The eggs were somehow hard and runny at the same time. I do not even know how you do that. Breakfast was bad enough we did not go back to the restaurant for dinner. We tried the Provisions for other breakfasts and lunch. It was okay. The hotel was recently remodeled. They do not need to tell you that there is still construction debris in the room and construction errors that have not been corrected yet doors hung incorrectly painted over outlets etc. The door opens to the smallest sliver of parking lot most of the time you are walking down the sidewalk to a parking lot further away. it is an odd configuration. I slept very well on the bed. I found it very comfortable. My husband spent the trip slathered in BenGay because the bed hurt his back so much. So it probably just depends on your back and what you need. Bed is very springy. The catering staff is very friendly and helpful if you are having an event here. But almost everything else about our stay ended up being a disappointment and not at all what I have experienced at other Hiltons.

Most impressive hospitality employee I ’ve seen. I ’m giving this hotel a 5 star review based on one reason the shuttle van driver George Mironovich. He dropped me off at the Wolf River Greenway for a run. When I called for pickup 5x there was no answer so I started the run back after 10 miles and I came around the corner and there was George. He knew what I was trying to do and had a few minutes between runs and came out even though he had n’t received a call. This level of thinking and initiative are rare. I applaud George.

This is an aging property. Hilton is doing what it can to maintain and update where possible. Overall cleanliness and layout. Staff at check in was unfriendly and did not provide my breakfast pass they I paid for. The breakfast was not all that good.

Very noisy through the night. Please read review for explanation. Clean room. Knocking noise all through the night Approximately evey half hour. Each time my wife and I got up there was no one at the door. Each time there were three knocks. Could have been heating system. Reported with no change. Called management next day Art. Apologised and said half payment would be reimbursed within 24 hours. No reimbursement received within 24 hours. Called accounting Daniel. Apologised and payment would arrive within 3 5 days. Finally received 4 days later. This was not about payment but to investigate and improve experience for future customers. Hope this is a helpful review and hope to use The Hilton which usually has a good reputation in the future. Thank you for your cooperation. Respectfully Richard Keith room 2307.

Excellent. Location of the property was good but with the traffic flow you may miss your turn. Area is good and has great resturants near. The elevators needs to be updated and we went to several floors looking for vending machines and we only found ice machines.
